links.title: Tim Cook Killed Apple's Dr. Dre-Inspired TV Series Because It Was Too Violent, Report Says
links.description: Tim Cook personally rejected a show based on Dr. Dre's life that featured drugs, guns and an orgy, the Wall Street Journal reported in an in-depth story about Apple's streaming strategy. The insight comes as Apple is pushing forward on its quest to compete with Netflix-only with less cursing, fewer (if any) sex scenes, and tamer subject matter.

links.title: Inside Westworld: A Lesson about Game Theory - Investors Perspective
links.description: Westworld captivated audiences for a second season with surprising reveals, untimely deaths, and more unanswered questions. The reimagined 70's film set in a western theme park, sits at the intersection of man and machine, where humans act out their most depraved fantasies until a robot uprising threatens to destroy both the real and fantasy world.

links.title: James Woods Suspended From Twitter Over Satirical Meme That Could "Impact An Election"
links.description: Outspoken conservative actor James Woods was suspended from posting to Twitter over a two-month-old satirical meme which very clearly parodies a Democratic advertisement campaign. While the actor's tweets are still visible, he is unable to post new content.
